page.title: 06Churches and a Chapel
page.content: Empingham has a large church with a fine crocketed spire atop a tower and dates back to the 13th century. The present incumbent is also part time prison chaplain to the nearby Stocken Hall and lives in a modern rectory. The main Sunday service is the Parish Eucharist using Rite B in the ASB. There are some 30 to 40 regular communicants going up to over 100 on festival occasions. At Christmas, harvest,Easter, there are joint services with the Methodist Chapel. The Chapel is part of the Stamford Circuit and has a small but hard working congregation who also run a number of activities for young people including a holiday club. Roman Catholics in the area have to go to Exton or Oakham. Whitwell has a small church.
